title: Managing water scarcity with better data | Hong Yang

tasks.task: Presenting an idea on managing water scarcity for food security in sub-Saharan Africa
subtasks: Discuss world population growth
Explain high percentage of water used for irrigation (70%)
Highlight challenges of producing more food with limited water resources
Address international trade and virtual water
Differentiate between physical water scarcity and food production in sub-Saharan Africa
Present studies on factors influencing yield growth in sub-Saharan Africa
Demonstrate simulated maize yield results (e.g., current average, impact of water and fertilizer supply)
Explain potential for doubling or tripling maize yield in sub-Saharan Africa
Discuss the need for sustainable, equitable, and economic methods to realize Africa's food supply potential

tasks.task: Presenting an idea on managing water scarcity for food security in sub-Saharan Africa
subtasks: Discuss world population growth leading to increased food demand
Explain high percentage of water used for irrigation (~70%) and its impact
Highlight the challenge of producing more food with limited water resources
Address international trade and virtual water concepts
Differentiate between physical water scarcity and low crop yields in SSA
Present study findings on factors affecting yield growth in SSA using crop models and GIS
Show simulated results indicating increased fertilization over water supply leads to higher yields
Explain potential yield improvements (e.g., doubling, tripling) and their economic implications
Emphasize the need for sustainable, equitable, and economic approaches to realizing Africa's potential
